free_text.Prerequisite for: Bachelor and Master-level courses in Probability and statistics
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Notions of differential and integral calculus and of linear algebra
free_text.Content: [b]1.	Axioms of probability theory[/b][br/]Outcome set and events. Axioms for calculating probabilities.[br/][b]2.	Combinatorics[/b][br/]Equiprobability. Basic formulas. Generating functions.[br/][b]3.	Conditional probability and independence[/b][br/]Bayes: formula. Independence.[br/][b]4.	Random variables (RV)[/b][br/]Definition. Distribution function. Discrete RVs. Main discrete distributions. Distribution of a function of a RV. Expectation and variance of a RV.[br/][b]5.	Continuous random variables[/b][br/]Uniform and Gaussian RVs. Other continuous distributions.[br/][b]6.	Moments[/b][br/]Moments of univariate and bivariate RVs. Moment generating function.[br/][b]7.	Random vectors[/b][br/]Definition. Independence of RVs. Sums of independent RVs. Correlation. Multivariate Normal distribution. Marginal distribution. Conditional distributions. Conditional expectation.[br/][b]8.	Limit theorems[/b][br/] Law of large numbers. Central limit theorem. Inequalities. Convergences.
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra lecture and exercises in the classroom
free_text.Learning outcomes: Provide students with the basic notions of probability theory. By the end of the course, students should be capable of modelling random phenomena and of using probability theory to study such models.
